description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: The Measure resource provides the definition of a quality measure.

url.description: An absolute URL that is used to identify this measure when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this measure is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the measure. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).

identifier.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this measure when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

version.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the measure when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the measure author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions are orderable. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.

name.description: A natural language name identifying the measure. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

title.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the measure.

status.description: The status of this measure. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

experimental.description: A flag to indicate that this measure is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

date.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the measure was published. The date must change when the business version changes, if it does, and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the measure changes.

description.description: A free text natural language description of the measure from the consumer's perspective.

purpose.description: Explains why this measure is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

usage.description: A detailed description of how the measure is used from a clinical perspective.

approvalDate.description: The date on which the asset content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

lastReviewDate.description: The date on which the asset content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after that, but doesn't change the original approval date.

effectivePeriod.description: The period during which the measure content was or is planned to be effective.

useContext.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching of code system definitions.

jurisdiction.description: A jurisdiction in which the measure is intended to be used.

topic.description: Clinical topics related to the content of the measure.

contributor.description: A contributor to the content of the measure, including authors, editors, reviewers, and endorsers.

publisher.description: The name of the individual or organization that published the measure.

contact.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

copyright.description: A copyright statement relating to the measure and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the measure.

relatedArtifact.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

library.description: A reference to a Library resource containing the formal logic used by the measure.

disclaimer.description: A disclaimer for the use of the measure.

scoring.description: The measure scoring type, e.g. proportion, CV.

type.description: The measure type, e.g. process, outcome.

riskAdjustment.description: A description of the risk adjustment factors that may impact the resulting score for the measure and how they may be accounted for when computing and reporting measure results.

rateAggregation.description: A description of the rate aggregation for the measure.

clinicalRecommendationStatement.description: The clinical recommendation statement for the measure.

improvementNotation.description: Improvement notation for the measure, e.g. higher score indicates better quality.

definition.description: A narrative description of the complete measure calculation.

guidance.description: Additional guidance for the measure including how it can be used in a clinical context, and the intent of the measure.

set.description: The measure set, e.g. Preventive Care and Screening.

group.description: A group of population criteria for the measure.

supplementalData.description: The supplemental data criteria for the measure report, specified as either the name of a valid CQL expression within a referenced library, or a valid FHIR Resource Path.

allOf.description: The Measure resource provides the definition of a quality measure.

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the group. This identifier will used to report data for the group in the measure report.

name.description: Optional name or short description of this group.

description.description: The human readable description of this population group.

population.description: A population criteria for the measure.

stratifier.description: The stratifier criteria for the measure report, specified as either the name of a valid CQL expression defined within a referenced library, or a valid FHIR Resource Path.

allOf.description: The Measure resource provides the definition of a quality measure.

identifier.description: A unique identifier for the population criteria. This identifier is used to report data against this criteria within the measure report.

name.description: Optional name or short description of this population.

description.description: The human readable description of this population criteria.

criteria.description: The name of a valid referenced CQL expression (may be namespaced) that defines this population criteria.

allOf.description: The Measure resource provides the definition of a quality measure.

identifier.description: The identifier for the stratifier used to coordinate the reported data back to this stratifier.

criteria.description: The criteria for the stratifier. This must be the name of an expression defined within a referenced library.

path.description: The path to an element that defines the stratifier, specified as a valid FHIR resource path.

allOf.description: The Measure resource provides the definition of a quality measure.

identifier.description: An identifier for the supplemental data.

usage.description: An indicator of the intended usage for the supplemental data element. Supplemental data indicates the data is additional information requested to augment the measure information. Risk adjustment factor indicates the data is additional information used to calculate risk adjustment factors when applying a risk model to the measure calculation.

criteria.description: The criteria for the supplemental data. This must be the name of a valid expression defined within a referenced library, and defines the data to be returned for this element.

path.description: The supplemental data to be supplied as part of the measure response, specified as a valid FHIR Resource Path.
